content.description: Start low on large flat pinchable edge. Move upward relatively direct on smaller edges. Mantle on top.
content.location: Detroit Boulder to the right of the Hollywood Bowl. This problem starts right in front of a rock on the ground that makes for a nice seat but a worry for the padless climber. To the right of two trees.

content.description: Start on juggy horizontal, use big reaches or high feet and continue up and right on juggy horizontals.
content.location: This is on the left side on the Ozzy slab slab face. Left side of the staged climbing area. Just right of the arete.

content.description: Start on edge. Move to lip and then mantle.
content.location: To the left of Longshot. It's a small boulder that you mantle.

content.description:
Appears in the DCA as 'Unamed 5.11'...really a highball problem.  

  Climb the crimpy, overhanging face left of the arete and then the arete to the top.  

  The topout is slopey but there are hidden mossy jugs.
content.protection: Pad...or three. Can be TRed off bolts. Could lead on small gear.
content.location: On the left arete of the SE side of the bolt boulder, left of the tall, overhanging face.

content.description:
Another highball that appears as an unamed YDS graded route in the guides. 

  Climb the black street to the top out right of the arete.
content.protection: Pad may actually be necessary on this one...TR if you want to draw a spectacle.
content.location: SE end of the Bolt Boulder...obvious black streak.

content.description: Sit start, then long move out right to sloper. Match here, then move out to sidepull(jug breaks are off). Then out and right to seam. Finish up through Reignition for top out.
content.location: Left of Reignition.

content.description: General Lee's crimpier badder brother. Crimps all the way up to a static to a nice shelf.
content.location: On the front face of the Ozzy Boulder. Go down to the right arete and find the tiny crimps.

content.description: Crimps all the way up--hence the name...
content.protection: Pad...spotter's not really going to help, The Gill Problem is directly behind you (as in 1-2 ft. behind you)
content.location: On the boulder that's by the gap that runs to the left of The Gill Problem.

content.description:
Fun, varied traverse, right to left. Start matched on slopers by Tree Problem, work up on slopey ledge until the slopers become a rail, then down following the chalk to two corner holds. Fun "rock star" move via a key toe...twist and push up past the blue paint to the topmost chalky ledge. Classic!

youtube.com/watch?v=u1riQwy…
content.location: downhill from the right arete of Ozzy

content.description:
Start on Jugs to the left of Tree Problem. Traverse left until you get to good holds. Match and you're done.

 Link to Beta: youtube.com/watch?v=u1riQwy…
content.location: Left of Tree Problem.

content.description: Small crimps with a short dyno to a  horizontal crack
content.location: below Hollywood Bowl on the short block with a horizontal break.

content.description: Do the Reignition Sit, but when you get to the flat roof where crack cuts right to go to the jug, just go left out of the smaller crack to jug just above the stump. After that, finish with tricky groove.
content.location: Hollywood Bowl

content.description:
Sit start matched on lowest edge. Hard shoulder move gets you matched on peak feature. Continue moving up to Reignition.

 Link to Beta: vimeo.com/215253269

 Climber: Ben Burkhalter Timestamp: 2:34-3:34
content.location: Hollywood Bowl

content.description: Stand start right hand on trianglular pinch with left hand on lower crimp. move up left side of cave then towards the middle to a large shelf. Top out with ridged sloper and holds above the shelf.
content.location: In the large bowl-cave (the taller one that you can stand in) with a large shelf on the middle of the upper lip. Problem is on the left wall.

content.description: Start on left edge of cave in curved right hand jug slot sidepull and left hand sidepull. Move directly up to pocket shelf. Top out. V3 in the DCA. Topping out rightward feels much harder than somewhat left.
content.location: Left Edge of Hollywood Bowl. Back side of the obvious slabby boulder (Ozzy slab)

content.description: Traverse the right lip of the Hollywood Bowl and top at the middle. Really fun problem.
content.location: On the lip of the Hollywood Bowl.

content.description: This problem is tall and ought to be respected. Stand start on obvious jug in the center of Ozzy Boulder and climb directly up, following the inset and least-featured face of the of the boulder, topping out to the right of water-groove.
content.protection: Spotter and a pad--maybe several if possible. A fall from the top would be serious, though very positive top-out holds make a fall from the top unlikely.
content.location: Ozzy Boulder at the rear of the main area. Good down-climb off the back.

content.description: right in the middle of the ozzy boulder. climbs directly up obvious crack.
content.location: ozzy boulder.   to get down just walk straight off the back where two boulders meet them jump off.

content.description:
Jimmy Webb's contribution to MRP. Start on Reignition Sit holds and move to burly left shoulder move. Match hands and work feet over until you have a huge left hand throw out of the cave. Double toe hook and keep tension to top this one out.

 Link to Beta: instagram.com/p/BuCsniYBvpR/

 Climber: Zander Waller
content.location: Hollywood Bowl

content.description: starts on the right side of the ozzy boulder to the left of tommy H. starts in deep jug about 6ft off the ground and then follows holds through the orange strak on the rock
content.location: right side of ozzy

content.description: A step up from Cheese. Fun problem that's really balancy, committing moves towards the top, especially with a big rock and tree below and behind you. Some stuff from Cheese is "off" while some is on. Horizontal crack that's the first move on Cheese is off--makes sense for the grade.
content.protection: A couple of pads. Place one on the rock at the base of the tree.
content.location: Between Cheese and the tree with the rock @ the base. Start is a vertical crimp on the ledge where Cheese starts.

content.description:
This problem tests your core strength. You're never more than four feet off the ground. Traverse right to left. Start off with a heel-hook with your right foot. Start matched on a good jug, move left for a crossover with your right hand.

 V1 moves- but don't let this rating fool you. Pumpy, endurance, technique- all around spectacular problem.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ut6eZOQW1uc
content.protection: Pad and your spotter to move it over the rocks below.
content.location: Keep walking past Ozzy Boulder, on your left. Looks like a tiny cave.

content.description: SDS, first move is the crux. Lock off left foot, power up to crimpy hold, match on it,  then use slopers via arete.
content.location: To the right of the Hollywood Bowl, adjacent to Profanity (V4).

content.description: Start on great jugs and climb the arete to a decent undercling. Long move to some bad holds, then with good willpower and feet, gain some good jugs to top out.
content.location: On the left arete of the Ozzy boulder. To the right of Maybe later and to the left of General Lee.

content.description: Start on jug slot, move to small slot up left, step up, use crimps, crimp/pinch with thumb, more crimps and such, head towards fat jug up right, profit. Guessing at grade, let me know.
content.protection: multiple pads to protect a fall on uneven ground.
content.location: Jug slot start in the middle of the right side of the Ozzy Boulder, right of Ozzy Crack and right of the tree.

content.description:
This is the start variation to the classic 'Godfather' problem in the Hollywood bowl. Ends at the jug in the middle of the cave.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lSRh5iAPIsY
content.location: Same start as 'Godfather' on the sidepull in the right side of the Hollywood bowl. Pull 4-5 moves to the middle of the cave and finish on a small jug.

content.description: Sit start on left-facing sidepull jug.
content.location: Hollywood Bowl

content.description:
This problem was said to have been put up by John Gill himself. However, as stated in the DCA--he didn't. That's why I like the alternate name for this problem: Vast Understatement. Start out under the obvious mantle. Wedge your right hand in the chalked crack, split with left foot on decent foot hold and reach up for a weary slopper, then match. For the taller climber, the next part is a simple static, for the shorter--a dynamic move is in order. A deep jug is up and to the right about a two and a half or three feet above the matched hold you're on. This move is the crux. Stick the hold, match, and work your feet up. Sit your feet, into the dish that you matched on before the crux. Lean in, grab the pinches on either side and scramble up to the top. 

  The jug that you have to stick for the crux is AWESOME! Check it out from above first if you want to get an idea for where your next hold is.
content.protection: A thick pad and a decent spotter with good depth perception. There's a slope behind you--falling on this one sucks. Watch out for the dicey top out--gotta know where those pinches are.
content.location: Walk in and when you see the OZZY graffiti on the Ozzy boulder, look to your left. See pictures for more info.

content.description: Crimps all the way with balancy footwork.
content.location: Smack in the middle of the Ozzy boulder.

content.description: Super fun reachy moves from jug to jug. This is my favorite V0 at Moss Rock and I climb this every time I visit.
content.location: Right side of ozzy Boulder. Between Immortals Only and Orange Streak. Start in a big jug and follow obvious “eyebrow” shaped jugs in a zig-zag pattern to the top.

content.description: Climb the tall face using small crimps. Starts off easy, then makes a very long dynamic move to a small, hard to see crimp (just below the base of a faint V shaped groove). Then make a spooky move to a small hold below the lip and work your way up.
content.location: Tall face to the right of Cheese and Maybe later; in front of the last tree before the arete.

content.description:
Move out from juggy horizontal to a crimp and pinch straight up.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f7czt3a4pp4
content.location: In the middle of Long Shot.

content.description:
One of the hardest problems at MRP. Start on crimps low and move up left with shoulder-y move. Continue left and finish up on Reignition.

 Link to Beta:

vimeo.com/215253269

 Video Credit: Ben Burkhalter Timestamp: 16:24-17:10 Climber: Sean D

Classic problem @ MRP, true to it's grade. Crux is footwork for the gaston and hitting the flake towards the top.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cIy6DOoyZ60
content.location: Back side of Ozzy boulder. Long shot will be behind you and to you're right if you're facing the problem. Cheese is to the left of the tree.

content.description: Begin in the seam break. Move up using small holds and up the seam. Once you match, get a high foot and make a high gaston move for the right.
content.location: Ozzy Boulder

content.description:
First off, it's not actually a V7. Start matched on the right with a heel hook. Now traverse left without using any hands/feet on the holds of Longshot. Top out.

 Link to Beta: youtube.com/watch?v=dAsfYDn…
content.location: Longshot Boulder

content.description: This makes up the main area of MRP. Everything from the well known "Gill Problem" (AKA Vast Understatement), to the V11 Reignition can be found in this area. All of MRP is bouldering with the exception of three top rope routes on the "Bolt Boulder". The rock is your typical Alabama Sandstone--good for toughening up those hands. Slopers are found throughout, along with some sketchy top-outs on a few problems. Everything can be found here from V0 to V11, however most problems are in the range of V4-V6.
